title: Pineapple Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: ½ cup canned, whole, cranberry sauce
instructions: In a small bowl, combine the pineapple preserves, the cranberry sauce, the chili sauce, and the vinegar.  Mix the ingredients well.
Brush the sauce over the meats or vegetables during the last 15 to 20 minutes of barbecuing.  Heat the remaining sauce and place it at the table
remarks: This pineapple cranberry sauce has an intriguing two-fruit flavor that’s accented by some chili sauce and vinegar.  It’s a perfect barbecue sauce brush-on for a ham steak with sweet potatoes.  It also brings out the best in pork, chicken, turkey, sausage, and carrots.  If you like, grill some fresh pineapple slices or peach halves and brush this sauce on the pineapple slices or peach halves the last few minutes. Yield:  Makes 2⅓ cups. Source:  Magazine clipping in Abby’s collection.
